sub_title: International trombonist/ workshopleader/ teacher/translator/writer/journalist/arranger/musical director/certified tour guide
summary:
Specialities: May is an allround tromboneplayer, a teacher and gives lectures/masterclasses around the globe about latin Music. Specialized in : directing (Latin) Big Band and latin music for woodwind ensemble and other combos, producing and arranging. She was correspondent for www.caribemagazine.nl and a reviewer for Antilliaans Dagblad, Curacao.                                                                She has three bachillor degrees: in Trombone Jazz - Conservatory Hilversum (Amsterdam), Electronic Organ-Conservatory Maastricht and Spanish Education-University for Applied Sciences- Tilburg, all in the Netherlands.
She is the author of two books:  ¡Música, Maestra! (2009) and Poco a poco (2016) published by Totemboek,the Netherlands.

awards.title: Moción de Felicitación
awards.description: Reconocimiento y felicitación a la señora May Peters, como reconocimiento a su desprendimiento e interés para la recaudación de fondos y ayuda para las familias puertorriqueñas tras el paso del  Huracán Maria.....

awards.title: #9 in the Top 20 Best Albums of 2013 of Puerto Rico
awards.description:
Ejercicio creativo de incalculable valor para el pentagrama nacional y la presencia femenina en él. May Peters aborda desde el jazz el repertorio de un puñado de íconos de nuestro pentagrama y lo interpreta de manera ejemplar al son de ritmos como la bomba, la plena, el cha cha chá y el yambú. Es ésta una idea ingeniosa que por su brillante ejecución en el trombón merece un aplauso. Más lo exquisito de la obra trasciende la música delineada a la perfección por el maestro Eric Figueroa para entregarnos también un valioso resumen de cada figura abordada, reseñada por el periodista e historiador Miguel López Ortiz.

Nederlandse vertaling: Creatieve uitvoering van onschatbare waarde voor de nationale muziek en de vrouwelijke  vertegenwoordiging. May Peters snijdt vanuit een jazz perspectief het repertoire aan van een handvol iconen van onze muziekgeschiedenis en ze vertolkt dat op een voorbeeldige manier op de klanken van ritmes zoals de bomba, plena , de cha cha cha en de yambú.  Dit geniale idee verdient alleen al een applaus door de briljante uitvoering ervan op trombone.  Het vernuftige van dit werk breidt zich uit tot de in de perfectie uitgewerkte muziek van el maestro Eric Figueroa en een waardevolle biografie van elke genoemde persoon , beschreven door journalist en historicus Miguel López Ortiz.

projects.title: Latin and Jazz clinics for Big Band and Woodwind ensembles
projects.description:
Because of her knowledge, experience and passion for the huge big band repertoire (from Sammy Nestico to Santana, from Glenn Miller to Noro Morales) May Peters knows how to make a real fiesta out of every concert. 
The emphasis will be on:

sectionplaying
frasing 
blending of sound 
listening 
tuning and interpretation 
At the section rehearsal (two hours) every section will be getting her attention! 
Her main issue is relaxation (through her humouristic way of teaching) and concentration. 

And you notice her succesful formula because of the enthusiastic reactions of musicians in the interior y exterior.

profile_positions.title: tromboneplayer, musical director; arranger; teacher ( Spanish /music) producer, writer/journalist

profile_positions.description: May is a multitalented, passionated and creative entertainer who played in 28 countries. Trombone player, organist, arranger, musical director, teacher/lecturer, journalist/writer and tourist guide! Her love and passion for all the good things the Island of Enchantement has to offer is reflected, besides in the many interviews she gave on international radio and tv, in two books : ¡Música,maestra! and "Poco a poco" (Totemboek, the Netherlands, July 2016). . She played with The Cubop City Big Band (the Netherlands); Ronald Snijders Extended Band (Surinam); the Festival di Tumba, Jazz Festival, (Curaçao), the Glenn Miller Memorial Orchestra (France/ United Kingdom/ the Netherlands) and the Glenn Miller Orchestra ( the Netherlands/Germany) and many more. May performed with her own band at  national Radio 4 "Opium" the Netherlands. She gave workshops and lectures in the Caribbean, the United States, Europe and South Africa. She is a dedicated teacher and big band director. As a writer May was a correspondent for www.caribemagazine.nl representing Puerto Rico and Curaçao, as well as a reviewer for the Antillean Newspaper.
